title: Ticket #460: Empty directory for gt4 file transfer can disappear
description:
To create a scratch directory for gt4 jobs on the remote server, the gridmanager needs to create an empty directory on the local system and ask RFT to transfer it. The gridmanage creates this directory the first time it needs it, then assumes it exists from that point on.

Nanohub has observed this directory disappear, cause unknown. All subsequent gt4 jobs with a scratch directory will fail at the stage-in state. The gridmanager should periodically check that this directory continues to exist, probably every time it starts a new job submission that will need it. If the directory has disappeared, the gridmanager should recreate it.
remarks:

Sometimes on our linux pool, the startd excepts with ENOENT on its execute directory, which is always invariably there, and dated properly, when I look. Does your problem result in a permanently removed directory or is it transient like the startd sees?

2009-May-07 15:28:06 by jfrey:
The directory is actually gone in this case.

2009-Sep-28 16:02:35 by jfrey:
Pushed a commit to V7_4-branch to check for and recreate the directory at relevant times.
